Topic.Title: and just how would that lesson be learned?

Message.Msg: Correct, you get paid the total value of your job and purchase insurance. If you have a spouse and children you pay for your insurance. An unmarried person would not have that expense, nor should they subsidize yours. As for any private employer they could choose to offer individual coverage, family coverage or no coverage. Yes I am in favor of anyone having the option to take the cash instead of employer based insurance. Current laws discourages options. Take the full value of your pay and shop freely for the best price and service instead of having health insurance dicated to you by your employer or the government.

Message.Title: What If McCain & Palin Had Won!?
Message.Msg: Just a few of the differences we would have experienced over the last few years! ""Well for starters the $350 Billion extended by Bush under TARP would have been returned to the Treasury instead of being ILLEGALLY spent on Crap! Second, if they had done a Stimulus (likely thru Tax Cuts), it would not have wound up in the pockets of UNION bosses and Obama cronies like Solyndra, and Wasted! It would have been invested in Real America! McCain would not have bowed to Arab Kings and apologized for America on every foreign leg of Air Force One! It's a sure bet that McCain, knowing real War, would not have used Killer Drones willy nilly, drones that have resulted in thousands of civilian deaths in "collateral damage"! McCain would not have spent weeks crowing about using Seals in a Kill Raid to assassinate Bin Laden, getting 22 of them killed in a Radical Islam Revenge Attack a couple months later! McCain & Palin would have approved the Keystone pipeline, putting tens of thousands of Americans to work at high paying jobs and creating 100s of thousands of jobs across the country!! Palin would have forced McCain to issue permits to 'drill baby drill' at sea and on land and they would not have wasted hundreds of Billions on Stupid Energy and florescent Light Bulbs!!! Palin would also have forced McCain to defund and kill all the beyond stupid Ethanol BS! McCain would not have sold assault weapons to Mexican Drug lords with no attempt to trace them, so he could point fingers at American gun owners, and then lie about it! McCain, being a pragmatist, would not have taunted Congress, Democrats and Republicans, by saying "I won", my way or the highway! McCain and Palin would have respected Businessmen, Business Owners and Entrepreneurs and encouraged them to help rebuild America... not to DESTROY Them and IT! McCain and Palin would not have run the Country like some Socialist Collectivist 3rd World Liberation Theologian freak show!"" Isn't it time to end the Barack Obama Horror Show!?

Message.Title: ORCL loses Itanium support case
Message.Msg: How the heck did they get caught up in this mess? http://www.reuters.com/article/2012/08/01/hp-oracle-idUSL2E8J1HJH20120801?feedType=RSS&feedName=marketsNews&rpc=43 'TREMENDOUS WIN' FOR HP Kleinberg's ruling did not address the question of damages. It is possible that a jury will now decide those questions. He wrote that Oracle is obliged to continue to offer its product suite on Itanium-based server platforms until "such time as HP discontinues the sales of its Itanium-based servers." Oracle is also required to port its products to HP Itanium servers without charge to HP, according to the ruling. HP, which is seeks up to $4 billion in damages, said the ruling is "a tremendous win" and expects Oracle to comply with its "contractual obligation as ordered by the court." HP had argued before the judge that Oracle and HP had agreed that support for Itanium would continue, without which the HP equipment using the chip would become obsolete. HP also told the judge in June that the commitment was affirmed when it settled an earlier lawsuit over Oracle's hiring of Hurd. The case in the Superior Court of the State of California, County of Santa Clara is Hewlett-Packard Company v. Oracle Corporation, No. 11-CV-203163
